title: Strictly's Shirley Ballas says beau Daniel Taylor has boosted her self-esteem
text:
She recently revealed marriage is on the cards with her boyfriend, just six months after embarking on a relationship.

And Shirley Ballas has shed light on her 'magnetic' romance with partner Danny Taylor as she features in the December 2019 issue of Platinum Magazine.

The Strictly Come Dancing judge, 58, admitted she has 'no inhibitions' with the stage actor, 47, as she enthused he's boosted her self-esteem and helped her feel comfortable in her own skin.

'I feel free':Shirley Ballas has shed light on her 'magnetic' romance with partner Danny Taylor as she features in the December 2019 issue of Platinum Magazine

Shirley was previously married to dancer Sammy Stopford between the ages of 18 and 23, and later tied the knot to ballroom pro Corky Ballas in 1985.

The media personality and fellow choreographer Corky - who share son Mark, 33 - divorced in 2007 after 22 years of marriage.

Since the breakdown of her second marriage, the dance adjudicator has kept her personal life relatively private - before she fell head over heels in love with Danny.

The Queen of Latin gushed she feels more confident than ever before in her new relationship as she explained: 'With Danny I can truly, truly, truly be myself.'

'I have no inhibitions': The Strictly judge, 58, enthused the stage actor, 47, has boosted her self-esteem and helped her feel comfortable in her own skin (pictured in July)

'I can truly, truly, truly be myself': The Queen of Latin gushed she feels more confident than ever before in her new relationship

'I have no inhibitions', Shirley added. 'It would have been dressing gown on, trying to put the dress on without even showing a little bit of flesh and now it’s like I’m free! I’m free!'

The Dancing with the Stars pro continued to heap praise on the theatre star as she revealed he's made her feel 'unique'.

Shirley elaborated: 'Danny’s showed me the way, particularly when it comes to self-esteem and how a woman should feel about herself.

Sweet: The Dancing with the Stars personality continued to heap praise on the theatre star as she revealed he's made her feel 'unique' (pictured dancing earlier this month)

Can't keep them apart: Insisting they're inseparable, the media personality explained: 'It’s an electric connection, like a magnet' (pictured in July)

'He’s taught me that God made each woman unique and that’s what makes you special. When you’re a teenager, it’s more physical first and then you get to know each other.

'What happened with Danny and I, we got to know each other first and at my age, the most important thing was the intellectual side of it, the fact that he was such a good person.'

Insisting they're inseparable, the smitten star added: 'It’s an electric connection, like a magnet.

'We want to talk to each other all the time, we want to be in each other’s company all the time, we want to go out of our way to see each other.'

Close: 'We want to talk to each other all the time, we want to be in each other’s company all the time, we want to go out of our way to see each other', she admitted (pictured earlier this year)

On tying the knot, the dancer - who cheekily asked her beau to propose to her live on Loose Women earlier this month - said: 'I’d have to be sure and he’d have to be sure.

'Of course, we take into account his family, his son and my family — but, as for the rest, it doesn’t really matter.'

In the work department, Shirley joins Motsi Mabuse, Bruno Tonioli and Craig Revel Horwood on the judging panel for this year's Strictly Come Dancing.

On helping her contestants improve their footwork through her criticism, she said: 'So many people in the country watch it. It’s not about me, it’s about what I can give to them.'

Read the full Shirley Ballas interview in the December 2019 issue of Platinum Magazine, on sale from Wednesday.
